item.title: Israel Gaza: Hostages shot by IDF put out 'SOS' sign written with leftover food
item.description: The three hostages were mistakenly killed in Gaza on Friday by Israeli troops.

item.title: Michelle Mone admits she stands to benefit from £60m PPE profit
item.description: In an exclusive interview, the ex-Tory peer says she and her husband were made "scapegoats" for PPE failings.

item.title: Chaotic scenes as people run after lorries carrying aid in Gaza
item.description: The vehicles carrying aid through the city of Rafah in Gaza were mobbed by crowds.

item.title: Alex Batty: French couple give details about British teen’s life
item.description: Alex Batty is back in the UK after vanishing on a holiday in Spain in 2017 with his mother and grandfather.

item.title: Moment landslide sweeps down mountainside into Lake Garda
item.description: The landslide created large waves and disrupted traffic on lakeside roads.

item.title: Why Covid is still flooring some people
item.description: A lot of us know someone who has felt pretty rough with the most recent form of the virus.

item.title: Shetland is first UK spaceport for vertical rocket launches
item.description: SaxaVord Spaceport on the island of Unst has been given approval from the Civil Aviation Authority.

item.title: Spiking crackdown to see more funding for test kits
item.description: Modernising the law and training for door staff are also among measures announced by the government.

item.title: Sellafield boss hits back at safety failure claims
item.description: Speaking to the BBC, the nuclear site's boss rejects hacking claims and accusations of safety failings.

item.title: Ian Wright: Match of the Day pundit to step down at end of season
item.description: Arsenal legend Ian Wright is to step down as a pundit from Match of the Day at the end of the season.

item.title: Serbia's Vucic claims big election victory for party
item.description: The president's party is set to win, projections say, but the opposition still has hopes in Belgrade.

item.title: Network Rail manager for stranded passenger line quits
item.description: Passengers were stuck in cold and dark carriages for hours recently after overhead electric cables were damaged.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing: Brian Cox turned down show as he's 'too old'
item.description: The Succession star told the BBC he likes dancing but is not sure he wants "to go down that road".

item.title: ICO's criminal investigations team looks into claims BBC withheld documents
item.description: Its criminal investigations team is looking into claims the BBC withheld documents related to Martin Bashir's interview with Princess Diana.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: Mone's Covid contract and 'Israel risks breaking law'
item.description: Michelle Mone's admission about a controversial £60m Covid contract features across Monday's papers.

item.title: Caroline Aherne: New unseen photos of ‘a light that didn’t shine long enough’
item.description: Images of the comedy performer help tell the story of her complex life in a new documentary.

item.title: Love Actually at 20: Are we still in love with the controversial Christmas classic?
item.description: Star-studded festive rom-com Love Actually is 20 years old, but it's a film that some love to hate.

item.title: Noisy nuisance or natural wonder? Why there's no easy answer to seagulls
item.description: Despite their high prevalence in many towns, experts warn that gull numbers are rapidly declining.

item.title: Ellie Middleton: 'Learning the way my brain works has changed everything for me'
item.description: Author Ellie Middleton on her late ADHD and autism diagnoses.

item.title: How a Dutch tragedy made people take loneliness seriously
item.description: After a Dutch woman's body was found 10 years after she died, politicians pushed to tackle loneliness.

item.title: Israel Gaza: The perils of hostage rescue
item.description: The shooting of three Israelis by IDF troops shows the risks of armed intervention in hostage situations.

item.title: How Taiwan became a semiconductor superpower
item.description: How an island that exported t-shirts and sugar turned into the world's largest silicon chip factory.

item.title: Netflix: What the viewing figures actually tell us about viewing habits
item.description: The Night Agent and The Mother were among the streamer's biggest hits in the first half of 2023.

item.title: Kenya's discreet church set up to welcome LGBT worshippers
item.description: The church set up to welcome LGBT worshippers in a country that is growing more homophobic.

item.title: The Yorkshire extended wrestling family helping to build belief
item.description: A club started by a dad wanting to make his son happy is now helping build confidence in others.

item.title: The mountain wilderness where British teen Alex Batty lived for years
item.description: Since disappearing in 2017, the 17-year-old has reportedly been living in a commune near the French town of Quillan.

item.title: Laura Kuenssberg: Five facts from a political year of gains and losses
item.description: Departures and by-elections, polls and Partygate fallout - how the political year unfolded.

item.title: King Charles's freezers help save food for a million meals
item.description: A low-key donation of 800 freezers last year has had a big practical impact on helping food banks.

item.title: Olly Alexander says Eurovision will be 'a wild ride' and that song is 'not a ballad'
item.description: "It's going to be the wildest ride" says the star, in the first interview since his Eurovision news.

item.title: Tom Lockyer: Luton captain still in hospital after cardiac arrest
item.description: Luton Town captain Tom Lockyer is still in hospital and undergoing "tests and scans" after suffering a cardiac arrest on the pitch during Saturday's Premier League match at Bournemouth.

item.title: Felixstowe same-sex couple receives one of Anglican church's first blessings
item.description: Prayers for Catherine Bond and Jane Pearce are held after approval from the House of Bishops.

item.title: Queensland floods: Airport submerged and crocodiles seen after record rain
item.description: Thousands of people in the Australian region have been evacuated but others remain stranded.

item.title: Israel Gaza: Lord Cameron supports 'sustainable ceasefire' and warns over deaths
item.description: Lord Cameron warns "too many civilians have been killed" in Gaza in a shift in tone from the UK.

item.title: Gaza: UK MP says family trapped in church area amid sniper fire
item.description: Layla Moran tells the BBC her relatives are trapped in a church complex as Israeli forces operate nearby.

item.title: More than 60 migrants feared drowned off Libya, IOM says
item.description: An overcrowded boat is believed to have been swamped by high waves after leaving the city of Zuwara.

item.title: Ilkeston: Murder arrest after group hit by van in town centre
item.description: Police say a man was killed and two others injured when they were struck in a Derbyshire town.

item.title: Seven-stone dog used to guard Somerset turkey flock
item.description: Farmer employs sheepdogs between August and December to guard his 600 free range turkeys.

item.title: NHS Tracker: Find out about hospital waiting times in your area this winter
item.description: As the NHS enters the difficult winter period, find out what's happening in your area.

item.title: Steve Coogan: Prince Harry's hacking case is 'start of something'
item.description: Actor and comedian Steve Coogan says the press needs "proper, independent regulation".

item.title: UK MP Layla Moran's family among hundreds trapped in Gaza church
item.description: Layla Moran's relatives and the Latin Patriarchate of Jerusalem say a sniper has killed two women there.

item.title: Homebuyers' stress over impact of CTS cyber-attack
item.description: Property completions were affected after the IT services provider was hit more than three weeks ago.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing 2023: Winner of glitterball trophy announced
item.description: Bobby Brazier, Layton Williams and Ellie Leach all fought to land the glitterball trophy.

item.title: Watch: Sun emits strongest solar flare in years
item.description: Space agency Nasa captured the burst that temporarily disrupted radio communication on Earth.

item.title: Cardinal Becciu: Vatican court convicts former Pope adviser of financial crimes
item.description: Italian cardinal Angelo Becciu is sentenced to five-and-a-half years in jail for financial crimes.

item.title: Kuwaiti leader Sheikh Nawaf al-Ahmed dies aged 86
item.description: Sheikh Emir Nawaf al-Ahmad al-Jaber al-Sabah had led the country for the last three years.

item.title: Alex Batty's long night journey home on unlit roads
item.description: It was the middle of the night when a delivery driver stumbled across the teenager in the Pyrenees.

item.title: Trains and ferries cancelled as warning for heavy rain in force
item.description: A Met Office weather warning for heavy rain has been issued for parts of Scotland on Sunday.

item.title: Gaynor Lord: Body shows no signs of suspicious death
item.description: The body of a woman found in the River Wensum is expected to be formally identified on Sunday.

item.title: Matthew Perry death an accident caused by ketamine - coroner
item.description: The Friends star was found unresponsive in the pool of his Los Angeles home in October.

item.title: Rangers 1-0 Aberdeen: Indomitable James Tavernier drags side to Viaplay Cup triumph
item.description: After a final of thud and blunder, it fell to Rangers captain James Tavernier to come up with the one moment that mattered.

item.title: Stade Francais 24-27 Leicester - Investec Champions Cup: Archie Vanes hat-trick seals dramatic win
item.description: Hooker Archie Vanes scores a hat-trick of tries as Leicester Tigers edge Stade Francais in a pulsating Champions Cup match.

item.title: Bayern Munich 3-0 VfB Stuttgart: Harry Kane scores 20th Bundesliga goal
item.description: Harry Kane scores a double to become the quickest player to reach 20 Bundesliga goals as Bayern Munich beat fourth-placed Stuttgart.

item.title: Women's Super League: Longer games, more cards, same goals - the best stats so far
item.description: As the Women's Super League pauses for the winter break, BBC Sport looks at the best stats so far with the title race and relegation battle set to the tightest yet.

item.title: Match of the Day 2: Emiliano Martinez & Neal Maupay amuse pundits
item.description: Match of the Day 2 pundits see the funny side of the spat between Aston Villa's Emiliano Martinez and Brentford's Neal Maupay that sparked a melee at the end of their Premier League match.

item.title: PDC World Championship 2024: Fallon Sherrock loses to Jermaine Wattimena
item.description: Fallon Sherrock fails in her bid to progress at the 2024 PDC World Championship as she is knocked out in the first round by Jermaine Wattimena.
